discussion.content:
B. 10% of customers have not re-ordered in this financial year.
E. MNO Manufacturing is experiencing a fall in orders due in part to the increased marketing activities of its competitors.

These statements provide reasons and context for why the project is being initiated. They highlight specific issues and challenges that the project aims to address, such as customer retention and the competitive market landscape.

choices.C: 1,500 orders are expected, each with an average profit of ֲ£2k.
choices.A: The Marketing department believes that sending a promotional calendar to current and prospective customers will increase orders by at least 10%.
choices.D: The Marketing department believes that the effect of a good company image, portrayed by a successful calendar, will last into a second year.
choices.E: MNO Manufacturing is experiencing a fall in orders due in part to the increased marketing activities of its competitors.
choices.B: 10% of customers have not re-ordered in this financial year.

questions.question_text: Which 2 statements should be recorded under the Reasons heading?

discussion.content:
The Business options heading is used to describe the different ways of achieving the desired outcomes and benefits of the project. It should include a comparison of the costs, benefits, risks and timescales of each option. Based on the information provided, the two statements that should be recorded under the Business options heading are:

A. Produce a promotional calendar as a free Christmas gift to current and prospective customers. This is the favored option by the Marketing Director, as it is expected to increase orders by at least 10% and improve staff morale. The benefits would last into a second year and the costs would be funded from the business marketing budget.
E. Do nothing. This is the option of not initiating the project and continuing with the current situation. This option would result in no additional costs, but also no additional benefits. The order numbers would likely continue to decline, staff morale would remain poor and skilled staff would leave. This option would not address the problem statement or achieve the project objectives.

choices.A: Produce a promotional calendar as a free Christmas gift to current and prospective customers.
choices.D: Outsource the creation of the calendar to a professional marketing company.
choices.B: Use a professional photographer to create the photographs for the calendar.
choices.C: Create the photographs for the calendar internally.

questions.question_text: Which 2 statements should be recorded under the Business options heading?
Which 2 statements should be recorded under the Expected benefits heading?

choices.D: The calendar will contain photos of both staff and company products.
choices.A: Increase orders by at least 10% with a minimum of 10 further orders from the list of prospective customers within 12 months.
choices.C: The Marketing department believes that the benefits of a good company image, as portrayed by a successful calendar, will last into a second year and bring the same increase in orders.
choices.E: The Marketing department want a very high quality, glossy product as they believe this will be more appealing to customers.
choices.B: It will be similar to calendars sent out in previous years

discussion.content:
The Expected benefits heading should include statements that describe the positive outcomes that are anticipated as a result of the project. These benefits should be specific, measurable, and directly related to the project’s objectives. Based on the information provided, the two statements that should be recorded under the Expected benefits heading are:

A. Increase orders by at least 10% with a minimum of 10 further orders from the list of prospective customers within 12 months. This is a specific and measurable benefit that directly relates to the project’s objective of increasing order numbers.

C. The Marketing department believes that the benefits of a good company image, as portrayed by a successful calendar, will last into a second year and bring the same increase in orders. This statement describes an anticipated long-term benefit

choices.C: Additional 10% increase in orders in year two.
choices.E: The print company requires a 2 week notification period of the calendar pack delivery.
choices.B: A recruitment campaign to fill the existing staff vacancies will need to take place in the next 12 months.
choices.A: Benefits will be lost if the project is not completed on time.
choices.D: The prepared calendar pack must be delivered by the first week in December.

discussion.content:
The 2 statements that should be recorded under Timescale are:

C) Additional 10% increase in orders in year two.

D) The prepared calendar pack must be delivered by the first week in December

questions.question_text: Which 2 statements should be recorded under the Timescale heading?

discussion.content:
D. The new company logo is estimated to cost ֲ£4k. This is a specific cost that will be incurred during the project.

E. Project costs are estimated to be a total of ֲ£26.5k. This is an estimate of the total cost of the project.

choices.E: Project costs are estimated to be a total of ֲ£26.5k.
choices.A: The MNO marketing budget this year is ֲ£120k.
choices.C: 10 further orders with an average profit of ֲ£2k will deliver a benefit of ֲ£20k in the first year.
choices.B: The project will be funded from the business marketing budget
choices.D: The new company logo is estimated to cost ֲ£4k.

questions.question_text: Which 2 statements should be recorded under the Costs heading?
